main.welcome: Hello! My name is Dalton Craven!
main.content: It’s hard to introduce myself over the internet, but here’s a little bit about me:

education.content: I’m a senior at the University of South Carolina. I’m pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science with a major in computer science and a minor in psychology (weird, right?). I’m also a McNair Scholar as part of UofSC’s most prestigious scholarship program, the <Link>University Top Scholars</Link>.

study_abroad.content: I have had multiple study- and work-abroad experiences while at university. I studied for both semesters of 2021 at the American University of Paris, weathering lockdowns & strikes while gaining valuable life experience. While at AUP, I completed coursework in both computer science & psychology, as well as in French language and culture.

content.intro: In the summer of 2021, in between my two semesters of study abroad, I completed my fifth internship at <Link>Qantev</Link>, working primarily as a front-end developer on a React-based application. I also learned Python and Pandas to single-handedly work on the "full stack" of a new feature.
content.conclusion: I then returned to Qantev during summer 2022, focusing on migrating our codebase from Javascript to Typescript. Over my 3–month period, I coordinated the refactoring of 55% of our files and oversaw the implementation of new TypeScript-specific best practices.

content.intro: I also do freelance web development! I work primarily with small businesses (although I’m open to other opportunities), with an emphasis on providing resources and training to ensure long-term functionality.
content.conclusion: To learn more about my work, feel free to visit my <Resume>résumé</Resume> or contact me at the <Contact>links below</Contact>.
